SVGLinearGradientElement.summary: The SVGLinearGradientElement interface corresponds to the linearGradient element.

SVGLinearGradientElementX2.summary: The x2 read-only property of the interface describes the x-axis coordinate of the start point of the gradient as an . It reflects the computed value of the {{SVGAttr("x2")}} attribute on the {{SVGElement("linearGradient")}} element.

remarks.para: The attribute value is a <length>, <percentage>, or <number>. The numeric value of the is the x-coordinate of the gradient's end point in the user coordinate system.

SVGLinearGradientElementY1.summary: The y1 read-only property of the interface describes the y-axis coordinate of the start point of the gradient as an . It reflects the computed value of the {{SVGAttr("y1")}} attribute on the {{SVGElement("linearGradient")}} element.

remarks.para: The attribute value is a <length>, <percentage>, or <number>. The numeric value of the is the y-coordinate of the gradient's starting point in the user coordinate system.

SVGLinearGradientElementY2.summary: The y2 read-only property of the interface describes the y-axis coordinate of the start point of the gradient as an . It reflects the computed value of the {{SVGAttr("y2")}} attribute on the {{SVGElement("linearGradient")}} element.

remarks.para: The attribute value is a <length>, <percentage>, or <number>. The numeric value of the is the y-coordinate of the gradient's end point in the user coordinate system.

SVGLinearGradientElementX1.summary: The x1 read-only property of the interface describes the x-axis coordinate of the start point of the gradient as an . It reflects the computed value of the {{SVGAttr("x1")}} attribute on the {{SVGElement("linearGradient")}} element.

remarks.para: The attribute value is a <length>, <percentage>, or <number>. The numeric value of the is the x-coordinate of the gradient's starting point in the user coordinate system.
